verses.kjv: Righteous art thou, O LORD, when I plead with thee: yet let me talk with thee of thy judgments: Wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper? wherefore are all they happy that deal very treacherously?
verses.web: You are righteous, LORD, when I contend with you; yet I would like to reason the cause with you. Why does the way of the wicked prosper? Why are they all at ease who deal very treacherously?
verses.ct: LORD, I know you are righteous, even when I bring my complaints to you. Still, let me ask you this: Why do wicked people prosper? Why do those who betray others live without a care in the world?

verses.kjv: Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root: they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit: thou art near in their mouth, and far from their reins.
verses.web: You have planted them. Yes, they have taken root. They grow. Yes, they produce fruit. You are near in their mouth, and far from their heart.
verses.ct: You planted them, and they've taken root. They grow and produce fruit. Your name is always on their lips, but their hearts are far from you.

verses.kjv: But thou, O LORD, knowest me: thou hast seen me, and tried mine heart toward thee: pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter.
verses.web: But you, LORD, know me. You see me, and test my heart toward you. Pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter.
verses.ct: But you know me, LORD. You see me and have tested my heart — you know my devotion to you. Drag these people away like sheep to the slaughter. Set them apart for the day of destruction.

verses.kjv: How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of every field wither, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein? the beasts are consumed, and the birds; because they said, He shall not see our last end.
verses.web: How long will the land mourn, and the herbs of the whole country wither? Because of the wickedness of those who dwell therein, the animals and birds are consumed; because they said, “He won’t see our latter end.”
verses.ct: How long will the land stay parched and every green thing in the fields wither? The animals and birds are dying because of the wickedness of the people living here — yet they say, "God won't see what becomes of us."

verses.kjv: If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee, then how canst thou contend with horses? and if in the land of peace, wherein thou trustedst, they wearied thee, then how wilt thou do in the swelling of Jordan?
verses.web: “If you have run with the footmen, and they have wearied you, then how can you contend with horses? Though in a land of peace you are secure, yet how will you do in the pride of the Jordan?
verses.ct: The LORD replied, "If running against foot soldiers has worn you out, how will you keep up with horses? If you stumble in safe, open country, what will you do in the thick tangles along the Jordan?

verses.kjv: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee; yea, they have called a multitude after thee: believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee.
verses.web: For even your brothers, and the house of your father, even they have dealt treacherously with you! Even they have cried aloud after you! Don’t believe them, though they speak beautiful words to you.
verses.ct: Even your own brothers and your father's family have turned against you. They've stirred up a mob to come after you. Don't trust them, even when they say nice things to your face."

verses.kjv: I have forsaken mine house, I have left mine heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.
verses.web: “I have forsaken my house. I have cast off my heritage. I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.
verses.ct: "I have abandoned my house and turned my back on my own people. I have handed the nation I deeply love over to her enemies.

verses.kjv: Mine heritage is unto me as a lion in the forest; it crieth out against me: therefore have I hated it.
verses.web: My heritage has become to me as a lion in the forest. She has uttered her voice against me. Therefore I have hated her.
verses.ct: My own people have turned on me like a lion roaring in the forest. They have raised their voice against me, so I have turned against them.

verses.kjv: Mine heritage is unto me as a speckled bird, the birds round about are against her; come ye, assemble all the beasts of the field, come to devour.
verses.web: Is my heritage to me as a speckled bird of prey? Are the birds of prey against her all around? Go, assemble all the animals of the field. Bring them to devour.
verses.ct: My people have become like a speckled bird of prey that other birds attack from every side. Go — gather all the wild animals and bring them to devour her.

verses.kjv: Many pastors have destroyed my vineyard, they have trodden my portion under foot, they have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
verses.web: Many shepherds have destroyed my vineyard. They have trodden my portion under foot. They have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
verses.ct: Many rulers have trampled my vineyard. They have stomped on my cherished land and turned my beautiful territory into an empty wasteland.

verses.kjv: They have made it desolate, and being desolate it mourneth unto me; the whole land is made desolate, because no man layeth it to heart.
verses.web: They have made it a desolation. It mourns to me, being desolate. The whole land is made desolate, because no one cares.
verses.ct: They have left it desolate, and in its ruin it cries out to me. The whole land lies devastated because no one takes it to heart.

verses.kjv: The spoilers are come upon all high places through the wilderness: for the sword of the LORD shall devour from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land: no flesh shall have peace.
verses.web: Destroyers have come on all the bare heights in the wilderness; for the sword of LORD devours from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land. No flesh has peace.
verses.ct: Destroyers have swept across every barren hilltop in the wilderness, because the sword of the LORD devours from one end of the land to the other. No living thing has peace.

verses.kjv: They have sown wheat, but shall reap thorns: they have put themselves to pain, but shall not profit: and they shall be ashamed of your revenues because of the fierce anger of the LORD.
verses.web: They have sown wheat, and have reaped thorns. They have exhausted themselves, and profit nothing. You will be ashamed of your fruits, because of LORD’s fierce anger.”
verses.ct: They planted wheat but harvested thorns. They exhausted themselves and gained nothing. Their crops will bring them only shame because of the LORD's fierce anger."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD against all mine evil neighbours, that touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit; Behold, I will pluck them out of their land, and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.
verses.web: LORD says, “Concerning all my evil neighbors, who touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit: Behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says about all the hostile nations surrounding Israel who have seized the land he gave his people as an inheritance: "I will uproot them from their own lands, and I will also pull the people of Judah out from among them.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them out I will return, and have compassion on them, and will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.
verses.web: It will happen that after I have plucked them up, I will return and have compassion on them. I will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.
verses.ct: But after I have uprooted them, I will turn back and have compassion on them. I will bring each nation home again — every people to their own heritage, every people to their own land.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, The LORD liveth; as they taught my people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built in the midst of my people.
verses.web: It will happen, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, ‘As LORD lives;’ even as they taught my people to swear by Baal, then they will be built up in the middle of my people.
verses.ct: And if these nations truly learn the ways of my people and swear by my name, saying, 'As surely as the LORD lives' — just as they once taught my people to swear by Baal — then they will be established and thrive among my people.

verses.kjv: But if they will not obey, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation, saith the LORD.
verses.web: But if they will not hear, then I will pluck up that nation, plucking up and destroying it,” says LORD.
verses.ct: But if any nation refuses to listen, I will completely uproot it and destroy it," declares the LORD.
